article.headline: Massachusetts 67, Hartford 62
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. (AP) -- Rashaun Freeman scored 25 points as Massachusetts beat Hartford 67-62 in Travis Ford's debut as the Minutemen's coach on Friday night. Freeman scored 17 in the second half, including a jumper and a tip-in to put UMass on top 55-50 with 5:01 to play. The Minutemen (1-0) took a 62-52 lead on Maurice Maxwell's 3-pointer with 2:27 to play. But Aaron Cook scored five points in a 7-0 run as the Hawks (0-1) pulled within 62-59 with 1:22 to play. UMass held off the Hawks from the foul line. Kenny Adeleke, a transfer from Hofstra, led Hartford with 20 points and 10 rebounds, while Cook finished with 15. Jeff Viggiano came off the bench to score 14 points for the Minutemen, while Stephane Lasme had four blocks, including one with 25 seconds to play to prevent Hartford from pulling within two points. Hartford led 31-29 at halftime and led by as many as four in the second half. UMass made only four baskets in the first 15 minutes, but erupted for 10 straight points, including back-to-back 3-pointers by Viggiano and James Life, to take a 22-20 lead. Cook hit a 3-pointer to give Hartford its halftime lead.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
